intro: Erigerodes harrisii, commonly known as the Harris' erigeron, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in arid and semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small and white or pale blue, often arranged in a cluster at the top of the stem. Erigerodes harrisii is known for its drought tolerance and ability to bloom during the spring and early summer.
